title: How to Make Steak and Mashed Potatoes on a Budget

steps.headline: Purchase an 8 oz.
steps.description: top loin steak. This is probably the best value for the type and quality of meat it is. This type of meat will run about $1.50 or $2.00 a pound.

steps.headline: Boil the vegetables.
steps.description: These vegetables will run you about a dollar, max.

steps.headline: Make the mashed potatoes with one potato and oil, 1/4 cup of milk, butter, salt, and pepper while you boil the vegetables.
steps.description: Begin by boiling two pots of water and pour one sliced potato into the boiling water. One bag of potatoes runs around $3.00, so one potato will cost about 25 cents, which is cheap for something that is really tasteful and filling. You can use half of a red and half of a russet potato to create a better texture for the final product. Allow it to boil and turn it down to simmer for 20 minutes. Poke it with a fork to ensure it's done boiling--if the fork goes through easily then it's time to take it out! Drain the potato and add in milk, butter, salt and pepper. You can now begin to mash them!

steps.headline: Keep mashing them to get out all of the lumps.
Add in chopped parsley for even more flavor.
Boil the vegetables for 4-8 minutes, depending on how you want it to taste.
steps.description: Don't leave the vegetables in for longer than eight minutes if you want to avoid the vegetables from becoming too mushy. The longer you boil the vegetables, the softer they will be.

steps.headline: Get your pan ready and pour a little oil in.
steps.description: Then set your heat to high. The best way to cook steak is to sear it and seal in that flavor because you want all of the juices to stay in there. If you flip it more than once than all of the juice will come out and it will end up being a really dry steak.

steps.headline: Add the steak.
steps.description:
When the oil beings to pop it means it's time to put your steak on the pan. You'll be able to hear it sizzle. To handle your meat, use a pair of tongs because if you pierce it with a fork the juices will be able to escape. Have your steak cook for a while and be patient for a few minutes.
steps.description: Don't give in to the alluring temptation and take it off too soon--allow the juices to sizzle and give the meat more flavor.
